study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the risks, outcomes, and management of contrast-induced acute kidney injury (CI-AKI) associated with iodinated intravascular contrast in cardiac catheterization procedures.
results_summary: The study highlights that iodinated contrast poses a risk of CI-AKI, particularly in at-risk patients, with graded associations to adverse outcomes like renal replacement therapy, rehospitalization, and death. It reviews epidemiology, pathophysiology, and management strategies for CI-AKI in cardiac catheterization settings.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing coronary angiography and percutaneous intervention, particularly those at risk for CI-AKI.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cost-effectiveness of radioactive iodine (RAI), anti-thyroid drugs (ATD), and total thyroidectomy (TT) as first-line treatments for Graves' disease in England and Australia.
results_summary: RAI was the least expensive therapy in both countries, while ATD was a cost-effective alternative. TT was unlikely to be cost-effective compared to RAI.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' disease in England and Australia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of different loop electrosurgical excision procedures (LEEP) for treating cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN), using visual inspection with acetic acid and Lugol's iodine.
results_summary: The study found high cure rates (93.2%-100%) across all LEEP categories, with no positive margins in specimens. Larger excisions (LEEP-A) were associated with lower pregnancy rates compared to smaller excisions (LEEP-C and D).
population_specificity: 466 cases of CIN (108 CIN I, 232 CIN II, 106 CIN III) patients.
effective_dosage: Not specified (visual inspection with Lugol's iodine only).
study_duration: Not specified (follow-up included pregnancy rates at two years post-LEEP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether a single-dose antihelminthic treatment (albendazole) prior to immunization influenced vaccine immunogenicity, using iodine-based techniques (Merthiolate-Iodine-Formaldehyde) to measure helminth burden.
results_summary: The study found no significant effect of albendazole on meningococcal or cholera vaccine immunogenicity. Iodine was used as part of a diagnostic technique but its direct effects were not evaluated.
population_specificity: Primary school children in Lambaréné, Gabon.
effective_dosage: Not specified for iodine (used in diagnostic technique).
study_duration: Helminth burden assessed at Day -28 and Day 84.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of prophylactic neck dissection in the surgical treatment of papillary thyroid cancer (PTC) and its impact on recurrence and survival.
results_summary: The study found that the role of prophylactic neck dissection in PTC management remains controversial, with indications, approach, and surgical extension still debated. While morbidity rates are similar to total thyroidectomy alone, the impact on recurrence and survival requires further research, with selective use in high-risk cases supported by emerging data.
population_specificity: Patients with papillary thyroid cancer (PTC), particularly those with lymph node involvement or high-risk features.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the prevalence of other autoimmune disorders in patients with chronic autoimmune thyroiditis (AT) compared to control groups.
results_summary: The study found a significant increase in the prevalence of various autoimmune disorders in AT patients compared to controls, with notable associations like AT+CAG+Vit and AT+CAG+Polym. The results suggest screening AT patients for other autoimmune disorders if symptoms persist despite treatment.
population_specificity: 3069 consecutive patients with diagnosed chronic autoimmune thyroiditis (AT), compared to age- and sex-matched control groups.

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the safety and risk factors for complications (e.g., capsular contracture, implant malposition, late seroma) associated with Natrelle 410 silicone breast implants, including the role of povidone-iodine pocket irrigation in reconstruction.
results_summary: The study found that the absence of povidone-iodine pocket irrigation was a significant risk factor for capsular contracture in the reconstruction cohort (p = 0.0006). No other direct effects of iodine were reported.
population_specificity: Subjects receiving Natrelle 410 silicone breast implants for augmentation, revision-augmentation, reconstruction, or revision-reconstruction.
study_duration: Median follow-up ranged from 2.1 to 4.1 years across cohorts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare treatment outcomes of differentiated thyroid cancer in patients aged above 60 years versus those aged 46-60 years, focusing on clinicopathological features, complications, and survival rates.
results_summary: Older patients (Group B) exhibited more aggressive cancer characteristics, higher complication rates, and worse disease-free survival compared to younger patients (Group A). The 10-year disease-free survival was 70.8% in Group B versus 87.6% in Group A.
population_specificity: Saudi patients aged above 60 years (Group B) and those aged 46-60 years (Group A) with differentiated thyroid cancer.
study_duration: Treatment and follow-up occurred between July 2000 and December 2012.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how spectral CT imaging enhances the use of iodine-based contrast agents in clinical practice and the potential for new contrast materials to improve diagnostic capabilities.
results_summary: The study found that spectral CT imaging improves lesion detection and enables differentiation between iodine and other contrast materials, enhancing diagnostic precision. It also highlights the potential for new high-atomic number contrast agents to further expand spectral CT's capabilities without increasing radiation dose or scan time.
population_specificity: Not specified (general clinical imaging context)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy in the treatment and surveillance of differentiated thyroid cancer subtypes.
results_summary: The study highlights that RAI therapy is reserved for differentiated thyroid cancer subtypes and is part of posttreatment surveillance, alongside imaging and tumor marker monitoring. It also notes that metastatic RAI-refractory thyroid cancer has limited treatment options, with molecularly targeted therapies being the current FDA-approved approach.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid cancer, including differentiated subtypes (papillary, follicular) and metastatic RAI-refractory cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the response to lenvatinib in patients with metastatic RAI-refractory DTC who were pretreated with multiple lines of TKIs.
results_summary: The study found that lenvatinib achieved a very good and long-lasting response in a patient with metastatic RAI-refractory DTC, despite prior treatments with multiple TKIs and chemotherapy. Careful monitoring and dose adaptation were necessary to manage side effects and ensure treatment success.
population_specificity: A 45-year-old man with metastatic RAI-refractory DTC progressing after multiple prior treatments with TKIs and chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to confirm the effectiveness of radioiodine ablation (RA) in treating iodine-positive cervical lymph node metastases (LNMs) of differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC) and evaluate whether size predicts successful elimination.
results_summary: The study found that 88% of iodine-positive LNMs were successfully treated by RA, with smaller LNMs (<0.9 ml) showing higher success rates (96%) compared to larger ones. Size was a significant predictor of treatment success, with sensitivity and specificity metrics supporting its utility.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC) and iodine-positive cervical lymph node metastases (LNMs).
study_duration: Follow-up diagnostic scans were conducted, but exact intervention duration is not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare image quality and intravascular enhancement between reduced-iodine-dose dual-energy CTA and standard-iodine-dose single-energy CTA in abdominal aortic aneurysm patients.
results_summary: Reduced-iodine-dose dual-energy CTA provided significantly higher intravascular attenuation (up to 185%) and contrast-to-noise ratio (25%) compared to standard-dose single-energy CTA, with no significant difference between contrast medium concentrations (270 vs. 320 mg I/mL).
population_specificity: Patients with abdominal aortic aneurysm (n=66).
effective_dosage: Reduced dose (21-27 g I) vs. standard dose (30-37 g I); contrast medium concentrations of 270 mg I/mL or 320 mg I/mL.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of low tube voltage CT protocols in reducing both radiation dose and iodine contrast media burden in patients undergoing CT scans.
results_summary: The review found that low tube voltage CT protocols effectively reduced radiation dose and iodine contrast media burden, particularly in pulmonary and coronary CT angiography studies. Most studies focused on arterial conditions, demonstrating consistent benefits in dose reduction.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing CT scans, with specific focus on arterial conditions (e.g., cerebral, pulmonary, coronary, thoracic, abdominal, renal arteries, and CT venography).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare perioperative and 5-year oncologic outcomes of robotic versus conventional open modified radical neck dissection in patients with N1b papillary thyroid carcinoma, including the role of radioactive iodine ablation.
results_summary: The study found similar perioperative and 5-year oncologic outcomes between robotic and open procedures, with comparable lymph node retrieval, ablation success rates, and recurrence rates. Radioactive iodine ablation was effective, with no significant differences in outcomes between the two surgical methods.
population_specificity: Patients with N1b papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC) and lateral neck node metastasis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of dual-energy spectral CT with low-iodine intake compared to conventional high-iodine contrast in CT angiography for DIEP flap examination.
results_summary: The study found that dual-energy spectral CT with low-iodine intake (270 mg I/mL) achieved comparable image quality and diagnostic efficacy to conventional high-iodine contrast (350 mg I/mL), while reducing total iodine intake by 22.86% and radiation dose by 11.01%. Subjective image quality scores were similar between groups, with no significant differences in CT values, CNR, or perforator vessel diameters.
population_specificity: 40 patients with BMI <28.0 kg/m² undergoing breast reconstruction.
effective_dosage: Group A: iodixanol (270 mg I/mL); Group B: iohexol (350 mg I/mL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review public health and clinical aspects of thyroid disease in the developing world, including iodine deficiency disorders and related conditions.
results_summary: The study highlights the qualitative differences in thyroid disorders between developing and industrialized countries, emphasizing limited access to diagnostic and treatment resources. It also discusses smartphone-based programs to improve thyroid disease care in resource-limited settings.
population_specificity: Developing world populations with thyroid disorders, including iodine deficiency disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and evaluate quality indicators for thyroid cancer surgery to improve oncological outcomes and reduce cancer-related morbidity and mortality.
results_summary: The study reviewed three potential quality indicators for thyroid cancer surgery: postoperative radioactive iodine uptake by remnant thyroid tissue, proportion of resected lymph nodes with metastases, and post-operative serum thyroglobulin levels. These indicators may help improve surgical care quality for thyroid cancer patients.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer undergoing surgical treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the frequency of lacrimal system obstruction (LSO) in patients undergoing radioiodine therapy (RIT) for differentiated thyroid carcinoma at specific intervals post-treatment.
results_summary: The study found that 4.55% of eyes (6.8% of patients) in the RIT group developed LSO within six months, while no cases were observed in the non-RIT group, highlighting a potential adverse effect of RIT on the lacrimal system.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma, divided into those undergoing RIT (group 1) and those not undergoing RIT (group 2).
effective_dosage: Not specified (high cumulative doses mentioned in the abstract but not quantified).
study_duration: Evaluated at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months post-surgery or post-RIT.

study_goal: To determine whether povidone-iodine application at the end of adjustable suture strabismus surgery reduces the suture colonization rate.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in suture colonization rates between groups treated with povidone-iodine and those without, nor between either group and the control group. No adverse effects of povidone-iodine were observed.
population_specificity: Adults undergoing adjustable suture strabismus surgery.
effective_dosage: One drop of 5% povidone-iodine applied directly over the sliding noose of the adjustable suture at the end of surgery.
study_duration: Single application at the end of surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify research and resource needs for characterizing the benefits and risks of iodine supplementation, particularly focusing on neurobehavioral development in offspring of iodine-deficient women.
results_summary: The study highlights the need for further research to assess the impact of maternal iodine supplementation on neurodevelopmental outcomes in offspring, emphasizing gaps in biomarkers of iodine status and sensitive neurobehavioral endpoints. No direct results on iodine's effects are provided, as the abstract outlines research priorities rather than findings.
population_specificity: Mildly to moderately iodine-deficient pregnant women and their offspring.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to discuss considerations for designing a trial to determine whether iodine supplementation during pregnancy improves neurobehavioral development in offspring in regions of mild iodine deficiency.
results_summary: The abstract does not present results but outlines methodological considerations for a future trial, including sample size calculations, follow-up timing, and statistical approaches.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in regions of mild iodine deficiency and their offspring.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to discuss the importance of standardization and harmonization in clinical laboratory measurements, particularly for thyroid function tests involving iodine-related hormones.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the need for metrological traceability and commutability of reference materials to ensure accurate and comparable laboratory results, with thyroid function tests (e.g., thyroxine and triiodothyronine) as examples of ongoing standardization efforts.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of laboratory measurement principles)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of iodine supplementation on maternal thyroid function and child neurobehavioral development in regions with mild to moderate iodine deficiency, as well as assess safe upper limits for iodine intake in pregnancy.
results_summary: Iodine supplementation improved maternal thyroid function in marginally deficient areas, but long-term benefits and safety for offspring neurobehavioral development remain uncertain due to lack of randomized controlled trials. Excessive iodine intake can alter thyroid function in susceptible individuals, but safe upper limits in pregnancy are not well-defined.
population_specificity: Pregnant and lactating women, particularly in mildly to moderately iodine-deficient regions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of povidone-iodine use on endophthalmitis rates following intravitreous injections, comparing outcomes with and without its application and topical antibiotics.
results_summary: The study found that omitting povidone-iodine before intravitreous injections significantly increased endophthalmitis risk, while excluding topical antibiotics did not affect infection rates. Povidone-iodine use resulted in lower endophthalmitis incidence (0.02%-0.05%) compared to cases without it.
population_specificity: Patients receiving intravitreous injections in Diabetic Retinopathy Clinical Research Network trials (2006-2015).
effective_dosage: Not specified (povidone-iodine applied topically before injections).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of iodine supplementation during pregnancy and its impact on thyroid function.
results_summary: The study highlights that iodine supplementation is recommended during pregnancy, though reference intervals for thyroid function tests in pregnancy are not well established, and the benefits of thyroxine treatment for pregnant women with mildly elevated TSH levels remain uncertain.
population_specificity: Pregnant women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of povidone-iodine with other antiseptics (ABRs and CHG 4%) for surgical hand antisepsis and assess the need for improved trial methodologies.
results_summary: The study found that povidone-iodine was less preferred compared to ABRs and CHG 4% for surgical hand antisepsis. It highlighted the need for better-designed trials using SSI as a primary outcome and proper controls.
population_specificity: Not specified (general surgical context)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to update evidence-based clinical guidelines for the management of thyrotoxicosis, including the use of radioactive iodine and other treatments.
results_summary: The study developed 124 evidence-based recommendations for managing thyrotoxicosis, addressing various etiologies and treatments, including radioactive iodine, antithyroid drugs, and surgery. New paradigms were presented for evaluating thyrotoxicosis and managing Graves' hyperthyroidism, particularly in pregnant patients and those preparing for surgery.
population_specificity: Patients with thyrotoxicosis, including those with Graves' hyperthyroidism, toxic multinodular goiter, toxic adenoma, and other causes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of minimally invasive procedures (MITs) like percutaneous ethanol injection, laser, and radiofrequency ablation for treating benign thyroid nodules.
results_summary: MITs, including ethanol injection for cysts and thermal ablation for solid nodules, achieved persistent shrinkage (>50% volume reduction) and symptom improvement, with lower complication risks compared to surgery. Hyperfunctioning nodules were not suitable for thermal ablation unless radioactive iodine was contraindicated.
population_specificity: Patients with benign, enlarging thyroid nodules causing local symptoms or cosmetic concerns.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the diagnostic value of iodine concentration (IC) derived from dual-energy computed tomography (DECT) for differentiating malignant cervical lymphadenopathy caused by thyroid carcinoma, salivary gland carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, and lymphoma.
results_summary: The study found that iodine concentration (IC) and the slope of the spectral HU curve (λHU) were significantly higher in thyroid carcinoma compared to other malignancies, aiding in differentiation. These quantitative parameters supplemented conventional imaging for distinguishing malignant cervical lymphadenopathies.
population_specificity: 92 patients with pathologically confirmed cervical lymphadenopathy due to thyroid carcinoma, salivary gland carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, or lymphoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the performance of single-energy (SE) and dual-energy (DE) CT imaging protocols for liver imaging, particularly focusing on the impact of iodinated contrast media.
results_summary: The study found that optimized SE protocols (around 90 kVp for medium patients and 90-120 kVp for large patients) produced up to 5% higher contrast-to-noise ratio (CNR) than blended DE images, with radiologists favoring SE scans. DE blended images did not show a fundamental CNR advantage over optimized SE images.
population_specificity: Medium and large size patients undergoing hepatic CT imaging.
effective_dosage: Not specified (study focused on imaging protocols, not iodine dosage).
study_duration: Not specified (simulation and clinical image comparison, not a longitudinal intervention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate biomarkers for assessing iodine nutritional status at individual and population levels as part of the BOND project.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about iodine's effects, focusing instead on vitamin A biomarkers and their relation to liver vitamin A concentrations.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on individual and population-level nutritional assessment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review patterns of invasion and contemporary approaches to investigation and treatment of patients with invasive differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), including the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) and adjuvant therapies.
results_summary: The study found that invasive DTC requires multidisciplinary assessment and treatment, with surgery and adjuvant therapies (including RAI and external beam radiotherapy) providing durable control of central neck disease. Aerodigestive tract invasion occurs in about 10% of cases, and treatment strategies vary based on the extent of invasion.
population_specificity: Patients with invasive differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of povidone-iodine treatment versus classical treatment (trifluorothymidine) for adenoviral conjunctivitis.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine treatment showed significantly higher recovery rates (96.4%) within two weeks compared to classical treatment (58.9%), with a statistically significant difference (p<0.001). Familial transmission was noted as a significant factor in infection spread.
population_specificity: Adult patients with adenoviral conjunctivitis at the Centre of Marmara Eye Health, Sakarya, Turkey.
effective_dosage: Three drops of povidone-iodine solution three times per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish the antitumour activity of vemurafenib in patients with BRAF(V600E)-positive papillary thyroid cancer refractory to radioactive iodine.
results_summary: Vemurafenib showed partial responses in 38.5% of patients who had never received a multikinase inhibitor, with common adverse events including skin squamous cell carcinoma and lymphopenia. The study concluded that vemurafenib represents a potential new treatment option for this patient population.
population_specificity: Patients aged 18+ with recurrent or metastatic BRAF(V600E)-positive papillary thyroid cancer refractory to radioactive iodine.
study_duration: Median follow-up was 18.8 months for cohort 1 and 12.0 months for cohort 2.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the current clinical features of newly diagnosed Graves' disease (GD) in Italy, focusing on the Merseburg triad (hyperthyroidism, goiter, and orbitopathy), and assess disease severity.
results_summary: The study found that GD in Italy has a milder clinical phenotype than in the past, with 45% of patients having no goiter, 16% having subclinical hyperthyroidism, and only 20% exhibiting Graves' orbitopathy (usually mild). Improved iodine nutrition and earlier diagnosis were suggested as contributing factors.
population_specificity: 283 consecutive patients (211 women, 72 men; mean age 47.4 years) with newly diagnosed GD from two Northern Italy centers (Varese and Pavia).
study_duration: Observational study conducted from 2010-2014 (follow-up at 6 months for hyperthyroidism control).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare recurrence and survival outcomes between asymptomatic and symptomatic papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC) patients and identify associated risk factors.
results_summary: Symptomatic PTC was associated with higher recurrence rates and lower overall survival compared to asymptomatic PTC, with asymptomatic cases showing better five-year recurrence-free survival (97.3% vs. 90.6%) and overall survival (99.4% vs. 96.9%).
population_specificity: Patients with previously untreated PTC of size ≤2 cm who underwent curative surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the frequency, mechanisms, and treatment of epiphora caused by chemotherapeutic agents, including radioactive iodine.
results_summary: Radioactive iodine was reported to cause nasolacrimal duct obstruction, contributing to epiphora. Early intervention with topical steroids and stenting was suggested to prevent severe complications.
population_specificity: Patients receiving chemotherapeutic agents, including radioactive iodine for papillary thyroid carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic accuracy of dual-energy CT (DECT) techniques for static myocardial perfusion imaging (sCTMPI) using iodine distribution mapping to detect hemodynamically significant coronary artery disease.
results_summary: The study found that dual-energy sCTMPI demonstrates promising diagnostic accuracy for detecting significant coronary artery disease compared to other imaging modalities like SPECT, invasive angiography, and cardiac MRI. It provides incremental value to coronary CT angiography by identifying reversible or fixed myocardial perfusion defects.
population_specificity: Patients with suspected or known coronary artery disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether stimulation with 0.3mg of recombinant human thyrotropin (rhTSH) prior to radioiodine therapy improves thyroid weight reduction and functional outcomes in patients with hyperthyroidism and multinodular goitre.
results_summary: The study found that stimulation with 0.3mg rhTSH before radioiodine therapy led to a reduction in thyroid weight and functional improvement in patients with hyperthyroidism and multinodular goitre with low uptake, without requiring hospital admission.
population_specificity: Patients with multinodular goitre (MNG) and hyperthyroidism (mean age ~70 years, predominantly female).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of dual-energy CT techniques in improving vascular imaging, including reducing iodine contrast agent doses and enhancing vessel visualization.
results_summary: The study found that dual-energy CT techniques, including iodine/water material decomposition images, improved vessel enhancement, reduced contrast agent doses, and minimized artifacts, enhancing diagnostic accuracy in vascular applications.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing vascular imaging (specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of povidone-iodine as an alternative antiseptic to chlorhexidine for use on the face and scalp.
results_summary: The study found that povidone-iodine is a safe and effective alternative to chlorhexidine, which poses risks to the middle ear and cornea. Povidone-iodine was highlighted as a preferable option due to its lower toxicity profile.
population_specificity: Patients requiring antiseptic solutions for surgical site infections, particularly on the face and scalp.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether low-concentration iodine-based contrast agents (270 and 320 mg iodine/ml) are noninferior to a high-concentration agent (370 mg iodine/ml) in enhancing coronary artery and myocardium imaging during CT angiography.
results_summary: The study evaluated the enhancement effect of low-concentration contrast agents compared to a high-concentration agent, measuring coronary artery enhancement in Hounsfield units. Results are pending as the study is prospective, but the design suggests potential noninferiority of lower concentrations for diagnostic imaging.
population_specificity: 318 patients with suspected coronary artery disease referred for nonemergent coronary CT angiography.
effective_dosage: 270 mg iodine/ml, 320 mg iodine/ml, and 370 mg iodine/ml (single administration for CT angiography).
study_duration: Single administration during CT angiography (duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the capability of dual-energy CT to assess iodine distribution and its impact on improving lesion detection and tissue characterization in the abdomen.
results_summary: The study found that iodine-specific images generated by dual-energy CT enhance tissue contrast and improve differentiation between normal and abnormal tissues, aiding in lesion detection. Additionally, DE CT allows computational removal of iodine influence, enabling virtual noncontrast images and assessment of other materials like calcium and fat.
population_specificity: Not specified (general application in abdominal imaging)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of TACE combined with an iodine-loaded irradiation stent versus a bare stent for treating HCC complicated by IVCTT.
results_summary: The study found that TACE combined with an iodine-loaded irradiation stent significantly improved median survival time compared to a bare stent (203 vs. 93 days) and had a high oedema remission rate (97%). Adverse effects were similar between groups and manageable with medical treatment.
population_specificity: 61 patients with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) complicated by inferior vena cava tumor thrombosis (IVCTT).
effective_dosage: Not specified (stent loaded with (125)I seeds strands).
study_duration: Not specified (follow-up until survival outcomes were measured).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether skin antisepsis with iodine (povidone-iodine) reduces catheter-related bloodstream infections (CRBSIs) and catheter colonization compared to other antiseptics or no antisepsis.
results_summary: The study found very low-quality evidence that chlorhexidine may reduce CRBSIs and catheter colonization compared to povidone-iodine, but no clear difference was observed when povidone-iodine was compared to no antisepsis. The results were uncertain due to underpowered analyses and methodological limitations.
population_specificity: Mainly adults admitted to intensive care units, hematology oncology units, or general wards with central venous catheters (CVCs).
effective_dosage: Not specified (antisepsis regimens varied from every 24 to 72 hours).
study_duration: Duration of CVC in-dwelling period (not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of micronutrient interventions, including iodine, on cognitive performance in children, particularly focusing on fluid intelligence and other cognitive domains.
results_summary: The study found that micronutrient supplementation, including iodine, significantly improved fluid intelligence in micronutrient-deficient children, especially those with baseline iron or iodine deficiencies. Effects on other cognitive domains were inconsistent.
population_specificity: Children aged 4-18 years, particularly those with micronutrient deficiencies (e.g., iron or iodine-deficient).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if valproic acid could increase radioiodine uptake and exhibit antiproliferative effects in patients with advanced, radioiodine-negative thyroid cancer.
results_summary: Valproic acid did not increase radioiodine uptake in any of the patients and showed no anticancer activity, with six patients experiencing disease progression. Four patients had decreased stimulated serum thyroglobulin levels with VA treatment.
population_specificity: Thirteen patients (median age 66 years) with advanced, radioiodine-negative thyroid cancer of follicular cell origin.
effective_dosage: Oral valproic acid adjusted to maintain serum trough levels between 50 and 100 mg/l.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine associations between thyroid disease and breast cancer, focusing on potential common pathogenesis or therapeutic approaches involving iodine.
results_summary: The study found no definitive evidence of a causal relationship between thyroid disorders and breast cancer, though hypothyroidism or autoimmune thyroid disease may slightly increase breast cancer risk. Current insights do not justify using thyroid-related interventions for breast cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Females with thyroid disorders and/or breast cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the rates of Frey syndrome between two surgical methods (partial superficial parotidectomy and superficial parotidectomy) for pleomorphic adenoma, using the Minor starch iodine test as a diagnostic tool.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in Frey syndrome development between the two surgical groups, with 21.9% of partial superficial parotidectomy patients and 27.8% of superficial parotidectomy patients testing positive for the syndrome. No recurrence was observed in either group over a 5-year follow-up.
population_specificity: Fifty patients diagnosed with pleomorphic adenoma who underwent surgical treatment at a single hospital.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide evidence-based guidance on managing Graves' hyperthyroidism, focusing on current treatment limitations.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that current treatments for Graves' hyperthyroidism are imperfect, with antithyroid drugs leading to high relapse rates and radioiodine or thyroidectomy causing lifelong hypothyroidism. No new findings on iodine's effects are reported.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' disease in iodine-replete areas.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical and microbiologic effects of a single subgingival irrigation with 10% povidone-iodine in addition to scaling and root planing for treating chronic periodontitis.
results_summary: Both the control and test groups showed significant improvements in clinical parameters after 6 months, with the most notable difference seen in deep pockets (>6 mm), where povidone-iodine provided a greater reduction in probing depth. No significant microbiologic differences were observed between the groups.
population_specificity: Twenty patients with chronic periodontitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the indications for thyroid remnant ablation using radioactive iodine in patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) and address methodologies for its use.
results_summary: The study highlights a shift from universal thyroid remnant ablation in DTC patients to a risk-based selection approach, emphasizing the need for careful patient evaluation. It underscores the therapeutic role of radioactive iodine in both remnant eradication and metastatic disease treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), particularly those post-total thyroidectomy or with metastatic disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of different cutaneous antiseptics, including povidone-iodine, in reducing catheter-related infection risk in ICU patients.
results_summary: The study found that 2% chlorhexidine (CHX-a) was more effective than alcoholic 5% povidone-iodine (PVI-a) in reducing catheter-related infections, while the efficacy of <1% CHX-a and aqueous 10% povidone-iodine (PVI) was uncertain or similar to PVI-a.
population_specificity: Intensive care unit (ICU) patients with central venous catheters.
effective_dosage: 5% povidone-iodine (PVI-a) and 10% aqueous povidone-iodine (PVI) for cutaneous disinfection.
study_duration: Not explicitly stated in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Povidone Iodine (PVI) as a skin disinfectant reduces infection rates in simple traumatic wounds after repair in emergency departments.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in infection rates between the PVI-treated and control groups (p=0.231). However, wound location significantly influenced infection risk, with lower and upper limbs showing the highest risks.
population_specificity: ED patients with simple traumatic wounds (85% male, wound sites primarily on head, lower limbs, and upper limbs).
study_duration: Until next ED visit for stitch removal (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers were examining the effectiveness of radioactive iodine as a standard treatment for differentiated thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine, when used after surgery, is effective for most patients with differentiated thyroid cancer, though targeted treatments for rarer subtypes (medullary and anaplastic) are reserved for progressive or symptomatic cases.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer, medullary thyroid cancer, and anaplastic thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effects and roles of multikinase inhibitors (sorafenib, sunitinib, and lenvatinib) in treating radioiodine-refractory thyroid cancer, not specifically iodine itself.
results_summary: The study found that tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs) like sorafenib, sunitinib, and lenvatinib showed promising results in improving progression-free survival in patients with radioiodine-refractory thyroid cancer, with lenvatinib demonstrating the most significant effect (18.3 months PFS vs. 3.6 months placebo). However, resistance to these treatments and adverse effects remain challenges.
population_specificity: Patients with radioiodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) or poorly differentiated thyroid cancer (PDTC).
effective_dosage: Not specified for iodine (study focused on TKIs).
study_duration: Not specified for iodine (study focused on TKIs).
interactions: None mentioned for iodine (study focused on TKIs).

study_goal: The researchers compared iodine intake between the Paleolithic diet and the Australian Guide to Healthy Eating (AGHE) to assess differences in micronutrient composition.
results_summary: The Paleolithic diet group had significantly lower iodine intake (-47.9 μg/day) compared to the AGHE group, but the study did not evaluate iodine's direct health effects or outcomes.
population_specificity: 39 healthy women (mean age 47 ± 13 years, BMI 27 ± 4 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish clinical practice guidelines for hysterectomy for benign disease, including the use of povidone-iodine solution for vaginal disinfection.
results_summary: The study recommended vaginal disinfection using povidone-iodine solution prior to hysterectomy (grade B), indicating its efficacy in reducing infection risk. No adverse effects or safety concerns related to iodine were mentioned.
population_specificity: Women undergoing hysterectomy for benign disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of iodine pleurodesis versus doxycycline pleurodesis and drainage alone in treating prolonged air leaks after lung resection.
results_summary: Iodine pleurodesis resulted in the shortest drainage time and hospital stay but was associated with significantly increased chest pain. It showed similar efficacy to other methods in preventing pneumothorax recurrence and had no significant differences in adverse events.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent pulmonary resection and experienced prolonged air leaks.
effective_dosage: Aqueous iodine solution (Tinctura Jodi) applied intrapleurally (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of tyrosine-kinase inhibitors (TKIs) for treating radioactive iodine (RAI)-refractory and progressive metastases in differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC).
results_summary: TKIs showed significant improvement in progression-free survival rates for patients with metastatic lesions, but they also caused severe adverse events and disease progression after discontinuation. The study highlights the challenges in determining optimal candidates and timing for TKI therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with RAI-refractory and progressive metastatic differentiated thyroid carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the role of routine or prophylactic central compartment lymph node dissection (RCLD) in differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) treatment, considering its benefits and risks.
results_summary: The study found that while lymph node metastases are common in DTC, the impact on long-term survival remains unclear, and the best indications for lymph node dissection are still debated. A general agreement was observed to reserve RCLD for high-risk cases, with a need for more research to identify predictive risk factors.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), including small tumors and microcarcinomas.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of iodine-based contrast agents in medical imaging, focusing on their safety, efficacy, and potential adverse reactions.
results_summary: The study found that iodine-based contrast agents are effective for enhancing imaging but are associated with more frequent adverse events compared to other agents. Hypersensitivity reactions can occur, though benefits in diagnostic accuracy often outweigh risks.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing medical imaging (CT, sonography, MRI) requiring contrast agents.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of iodine-alcohol versus chlorhexidine-alcohol for preoperative skin preparation in cesarean sections, focusing on wound complications.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in surgical site infection rates or other wound complications between Vicryl and Monocryl sutures, suggesting physician preference is acceptable. Iodine-alcohol was not directly compared to chlorhexidine-alcohol in this secondary analysis.
population_specificity: Pregnant women undergoing scheduled or unscheduled cesareans with low transverse skin incisions.
effective_dosage: Not specified (preoperative skin preparation method described, but exact iodine concentration not provided).
study_duration: Follow-up for surgical site infections was within 30 days post-cesarean.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether iodine-impregnated incision drapes (IIIDs) increase bacterial recolonization compared to no drape use in simulated total knee arthroplasty (TKA).
results_summary: The study found no increase in bacterial recolonization on knees with IIIDs compared to bare knees, both immediately after disinfection and after 75 minutes of simulated surgery. No recolonization was detected on either draped or bare knees by the end of the procedure.
population_specificity: 20 patients scheduled for TKA.
effective_dosage: Not specified (IIID use only, no dosage mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of iodine as a pleurodesis agent for managing malignant pleural effusion (MPE) against other treatments, focusing on pleurodesis success rates and patient outcomes.
results_summary: Iodine ranked fifth in pleurodesis effectiveness among 16 methods, with a 95% credible interval of 1 to 12, suggesting it is a highly effective option but with some uncertainty due to wide intervals. No significant differences in adverse events like pain or fever were noted compared to other agents, though data were limited.
population_specificity: Adults with symptomatic malignant pleural effusion (MPE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and patient comfort of different iodine-based contrast media protocols administered at high flow rates during coronary computed tomographic angiography.
results_summary: The study found that high flow rates of prewarmed iodine-based contrast media were safely injected without discomfort, pain, or stress, with no occurrences of extravasation. Enhancement levels in coronary arteries were consistent across all groups, indicating comparable efficacy.
population_specificity: 200 consecutive patients in a double-blind randomized controlled trial.
effective_dosage: 94 mL of iopromide 240 mg I/mL at 8.3 mL/s (group I), 75 mL of 300 mg I/mL at 6.7 mL/s (group II), or 61 mL of 370 mg I/mL at 5.4 mL/s (group III).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine optimal contrast media injection parameters for lower kVp settings while maintaining diagnostic attenuation levels in coronary CT angiography.
results_summary: The study found that iodine-based contrast media could be reduced by up to 56% at lower kVp settings (70kVp) while maintaining diagnostic attenuation levels, with clinical validation showing a 12% reduction at 100kVp.
population_specificity: Patients referred for coronary CT angiography (n=60) and a circulation phantom with physiological parameters.
effective_dosage: 300mgI/ml (Iopromide), volume=45ml, flow rate=6.0ml/s, iodine delivery rate (IDR)=1.8gI/s, iodine load=13.5gI.
study_duration: Not specified (fixed injection time of 7.5s in phantom study; clinical protocols varied by scan duration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the agreement between (124)I PET and (131)I scintigraphy in detecting iodine-positive metastases in patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma.
results_summary: The study found high agreement (97% lesion-based, 95% patient-based) between (124)I PET and (131)I imaging in detecting iodine-positive metastases, with both modalities identifying nearly all metastases. A few discrepancies were noted, but overall, (124)I PET was deemed reliable for staging and treatment planning.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma.
effective_dosage: Approximately 25 MBq of (124)I for PET/CT and 1-10 GBq of (131)I for scintigraphy.
study_duration: Imaging occurred 24 and 120 hours post-(124)I administration and 5-10 days post-(131)I administration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of iodized salt on mental development in children aged 4 to 6 years in an iodine-deficient region of Ethiopia.
results_summary: The study found no significant main effects of iodized salt on cognitive/language tests, but identified effect modifiers such as mother's education, child's sex, and diet. Benefits of iodine for brain development may be limited to children under 3 years or tied to educational resources.
population_specificity: Children aged 4 to 6 years in Ethiopia with high levels of iodine deficiency.
effective_dosage: Not specified (iodized salt introduced via market distribution).
study_duration: Not specified (pre- and post-iodization measurements taken, but exact duration not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether intermittent use of 5% povidone-iodine could reduce fungal infections after keratoprosthesis surgery.
results_summary: The study suggests that further research is needed to determine if 5% povidone-iodine, along with frequent replacement of the bandage contact lens, could reduce fungal infections post-keratoprosthesis surgery. No direct efficacy results for iodine were reported, but it was proposed as a potential intervention.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent keratoprosthesis implantation.
effective_dosage: 5% povidone-iodine (intermittent use proposed, exact frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the revised 2015 ATA guidelines on thyroid nodules and follicular cell-derived thyroid cancer, focusing on changes in risk stratification and treatment recommendations.
results_summary: The revised guidelines emphasize sonographic pattern over nodule growth for risk stratification, classify low-volume lymph nodal metastases as low risk, and recommend lobectomy for certain thyroid cancers (1-4 cm). The overarching theme is "less is more," reducing unnecessary procedures like biopsies, extensive surgeries, and radioactive iodine use.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid nodules or follicular cell-derived thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate iodine adjuvant therapy as part of the treatment strategy for thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The study mentions iodine adjuvant therapy as a well-known treatment for thyroid cancer after surgical resection, but specific efficacy results are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Individuals with thyroid cancer (no further specificity provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the development of nuclear medicine methods, including iodine-based diagnostics and therapies, for thyroid cancer examination and treatment.
results_summary: The study highlights the clinical use of various iodine-based and other novel nuclear medicine methods for diagnosing and treating thyroid cancer, noting their diagnostic and therapeutic utility but also unavoidable adverse effects.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid cancer (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: To study the effect of adjuvant lithium on serum thyroxine (T4) concentrations in patients treated with radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy.
results_summary: Adjuvant lithium led to earlier and greater decreases in T4 concentrations compared to RAI alone, with significant effects observed as early as 1 month in the lithium group. The response was particularly notable in women and patients with Graves' disease.
population_specificity: Patients with hyperthyroidism referred for RAI ablation therapy in Johannesburg academic hospitals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the cytogenetic toxicity of low-dose radioiodine in hyperthyroid patients using a cytokinesis-blocked micronuclei assay.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant difference in micronuclei frequency before and after radioiodine therapy, indicating transient and reversible cytogenetic damage. The results suggest low-dose radioiodine is safe for hyperthyroidism treatment.
population_specificity: 74 hyperthyroid patients (52 men, 22 women).
effective_dosage: Not specified (low-dose radioiodine in oral sodium iodine form).

study_goal: The researchers were investigating the potential of radiolabeled somatostatin analogues as a therapeutic option for advanced medullary and non-iodine avid differentiated thyroid cancers.
results_summary: The study suggests that peptide receptor radionuclide therapy using (177)Lu-labeled or (90)Y-labeled somatostatin analogues may be effective in managing thyroid cancers with significant SSTR expression, as identified by PET/CT with (68)Ga-labeled somatostatin analogues.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced medullary and non-iodine avid differentiated thyroid cancers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of chemotherapy in patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma refractory to radioactive iodine (CDT-RTI) through a systematic review of published studies.
results_summary: The study found a response rate of 22.1% across 13 studies, with complete responses ranging from 2.5% to 3.4%. Survival times could not be assessed due to data limitations and high risk of bias, but the results suggest chemotherapy may have some effectiveness.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma refractory to radioactive iodine (CDT-RTI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review clinical studies on parenteral trace element provision, including iodine, to inform clinical practice regarding nutritional therapy.
results_summary: The study concluded that prolonged insufficient supply of trace elements like iodine can lead to deprivation and clinical deterioration, recommending daily physiological doses in parenteral nutrition to avoid imbalances.
population_specificity: Adult patients receiving parenteral nutrition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of sorafenib, a multiple kinase inhibitor, for treating radioactive iodine-refractory advanced and progressive differentiated thyroid cancer.
results_summary: Sorafenib improved progression-free survival by 5 months compared to placebo in the Phase III DECISION trial, though adverse events were common but manageable. Resistance developed after 1-2 years in most patients, necessitating subsequent therapies like other MKIs or clinical trials.
population_specificity: Patients with radioactive iodine-refractory advanced and progressive differentiated thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The abstract does not specify a research goal focused on iodine; it broadly discusses causes and treatments of hyperthyroidism and thyrotoxicosis.
results_summary: The abstract mentions iodine-induced thyroid dysfunction as a cause of thyrotoxicosis but does not provide specific study results on iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of hyperthyroidism and thyrotoxicosis patients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of topical antiseptics, including iodine-based treatments, on the healing of pressure ulcers in adults.
results_summary: The study found mixed evidence regarding iodine's efficacy; povidone iodine showed fewer ulcers healed compared to non-antimicrobial alternatives in some cases, while cadexomer iodine showed no clear difference from standard care. The quality of evidence varied from moderate to very low.
population_specificity: Adults with pressure ulcers of stage II or above.
study_duration: Short follow-up times (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and outcomes of transscleral resection without hypotensive anaesthesia (TSRWH) versus iodine-125 brachytherapy (IBT) in treating choroidal melanoma.
results_summary: TSRWH showed better visual acuity preservation than IBT, but had higher local recurrence risk when the ciliary body was involved. Metastasis rates were similar between groups, though iris involvement and large tumor size increased metastasis risk.
population_specificity: Patients with choroidal melanoma (19 treated with TSRWH, 53 with IBT).
study_duration: Follow-up time was matched but exact duration not stated.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the accuracy of diagnostic dose (131)I scan, (99m)TcO4(-) thyroid scintigraphy, and therapeutic dose (131)I imaging for estimating thyroid remnant after total thyroidectomy in DTC patients.
results_summary: Therapeutic dose RAI scan detected thyroid remnants in all DTC patients post-thyroidectomy. Diagnostic RAI scan was superior to ultrasound and (99m)TcO4(-) thyroid scan for remnant estimation, while the latter two provided minimal useful information.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent total thyroidectomy for differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC) and received radioactive iodine (RAI) treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dual-energy spectral CT with ASiR could reduce iodine contrast dose while maintaining or improving image quality in CT portal venography.
results_summary: The study found that 60-keV spectral CT images with ASiR allowed a 25% reduction in iodine dose while providing equal or better image quality compared to standard 120-kVp images, with no significant difference in radiation dose. The spectral CT group showed higher CNR values for intrahepatic portal veins and similar CNR for extrahepatic portal veins.
population_specificity: 50 patients undergoing abdominal CT (25 in each group).
effective_dosage: Group A: 350 mgI/kg; Group B: 500 mgI/kg.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of topical antiseptics, including iodine, on surgical wounds healing by secondary intention.
results_summary: The study found no clear evidence of effects for iodine preparations compared to no antiseptic treatment, with limited outcome data and low-quality evidence.
population_specificity: Adults with surgical wounds healing by secondary intention (excluding skin graft donor sites and non-surgical wounds).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the utility of dual-energy computed tomography (DECT) for qualitative and quantitative analysis of iodine concentrations in oncologic imaging.
results_summary: The study found that DECT improves iodine signal detection, enhancing the conspicuity of pathologic processes and providing better understanding of internal structures within mass lesions. It also highlighted the technique's potential for improving diagnostic accuracy in suspected malignancies.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing oncologic imaging (specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the evidence supporting lenvatinib as salvage therapy for radioactive iodine-refractory thyroid cancer, focusing on its toxicity profile and efficacy.
results_summary: Lenvatinib showed significant progression-free survival improvement (18.2 vs. 3.6 months) compared to placebo in a Phase III study but was associated with moderate to severe toxicities requiring dose adjustments. The study highlights the need to balance efficacy with toxicity in treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with radioiodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of perchlorate exposure on thyroid hormone production and its potential health implications, particularly for vulnerable populations.
results_summary: Perchlorate blocks iodide uptake into the thyroid, reducing thyroid hormone production, which is critical for metabolism and neurodevelopment. Vulnerable groups like young children, pregnant women, and those co-exposed to similar agents may be especially susceptible.
population_specificity: General population, with specific focus on young children, pregnant women, fetuses, and individuals co-exposed to similarly acting agents.
interactions: Perchlorate co-exposure with similarly acting agents may increase susceptibility.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness and safety of antimicrobial dressings, including povidone-iodine cleansing, in reducing CVC-related infections in newborn infants.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in CRBSI or sepsis between chlorhexidine dressing/alcohol cleansing and polyurethane dressing/povidone-iodine cleansing, but chlorhexidine dressing/alcohol cleansing significantly reduced catheter colonization while increasing the risk of contact dermatitis. Silver-alginate patches showed no significant differences in CRBSI or mortality compared to standard dressings.
population_specificity: Newborn infants in level III neonatal intensive care units (NICUs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of (123)I-MIBG scintigraphy for assessing cardiac sympathetic nerve activity and predicting sudden cardiac death risk in heart failure patients.
results_summary: The study found that (123)I-MIBG scintigraphic parameters effectively predict adverse cardiac events, particularly sudden cardiac death, in heart failure patients, as supported by multiple clinical trials.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the importance of iodine supplementation in pregnancy, particularly in areas with mild-to-moderate iodine deficiency, and its potential benefits for offspring neurocognitive development.
results_summary: Observational data suggest substantial health and economic benefits from correcting iodine deficiency in pregnancy, though randomized controlled trials are lacking. There is growing support for iodine supplementation in pregnancy in mildly-to-moderately iodine-deficient regions, with dosage tailored to local iodine status.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in borderline or moderate-severe iodine-deficient areas.
effective_dosage: Not specified (needs to reflect local iodine status and iodization policies).

study_goal: To evaluate the efficacy of gemstone spectral imaging (GSI) in detecting residual or recurrent hepatocellular cancer (HCC) lesions after transcatheter arterial chemoembolization (TACE) treatment.
results_summary: GSI significantly improved sensitivity (97%) and specificity (94.4%) in detecting HCC lesions compared to conventional CT (72% sensitivity, 77.8% specificity). It enhanced tumor homogeneity assessment and identification of residual or metastatic lesions without increasing radiation dose.
population_specificity: 30 patients with hepatocellular cancer (HCC) post-TACE treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review nutrient deficiencies in pregnant women, including iodine, and provide recommendations for dietary supplementation.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the importance of adequate iodine intake during pregnancy but does not provide specific results on iodine's effects. It emphasizes personalized prenatal care and appropriate supplementation.
population_specificity: Pregnant women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review radiotherapeutic techniques and associated radiopharmaceuticals, including iodine-based treatments, for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
results_summary: The study found that iodine-based radiopharmaceuticals (Iodine-131-labeled Lipiodol and iodine-125 seed strands) are used in selective internal radiotherapy (SIRT) and interstitial brachytherapy for HCC, demonstrating effectiveness in targeting and destroying cancer cells while sparing normal tissue.
population_specificity: Patients with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), including those with unresectable or untransplantable cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of iodine in preventing postoperative seromas compared with talc and standard care in patients undergoing modified radical mastectomy.
results_summary: The iodine intervention was discontinued due to increased adverse outcomes, including longer drainage duration and higher total fluid drained, indicating poorer efficacy and safety compared to other treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with breast cancer undergoing modified radical mastectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of I-125 permanent brachytherapy (PBT) versus intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT) for treating inoperable salivary gland malignancies.
results_summary: The study is a randomized controlled trial designed to evaluate local control rates, progression-free survival, overall survival, and quality of life, but results are not yet reported in the abstract.
population_specificity: Subjects aged 18-80 with inoperable salivary gland malignancies, Karnofsky performance status ≥60, and adequate organ function.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current literature on the prognostic and management implications of lymph node metastases in differentiated thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that nodal metastases in differentiated thyroid cancer may confer a poorer prognosis, particularly in older patients, and suggests that characteristics like size and number of metastatic lymph nodes are also prognostic. There is a trend toward less aggressive treatment for low-volume nodal disease.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer, particularly older individuals with nodal metastases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize findings and recommendations on the epidemiology, diagnosis, and genetics of hypoparathyroidism, including rare etiologies like radioactive iodine therapy.
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine therapy for thyroid disease is a rare cause of hypoparathyroidism, but did not specifically evaluate iodine's effects or safety.
population_specificity: Patients with hypoparathyroidism, including those with postsurgical, autoimmune, genetic, or rare etiologies like radioactive iodine therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the causes and treatment options for hyperthyroidism, including the use of radioactive iodine ablation.
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine ablation is a widely used and effective treatment for hyperthyroidism caused by overproduction of thyroid hormones, alongside antithyroid medications and surgical thyroidectomy. The choice of treatment depends on diagnosis, contraindications, severity, and patient preference.
population_specificity: Patients with hyperthyroidism (e.g., Graves disease, toxic multinodular goiter, toxic adenoma, or silent thyroiditis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize progress in molecular medicine for advanced-stage thyroid cancers, including the role of radioactive iodine and other therapies, and identify future research directions.
results_summary: The abstract discusses regulatory approvals for drugs targeting medullary and radioactive-iodine refractory differentiated thyroid cancer but does not provide specific findings on iodine's effects. It highlights ongoing clinical trials and the need for further research on signaling pathways and personalized therapies.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced-stage thyroid cancers (medullary, differentiated, and anaplastic thyroid cancer).

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the use of the Minor starch-iodine test for objective testing of Frey syndrome symptoms.
results_summary: The abstract mentions the Minor starch-iodine test as an objective method for diagnosing Frey syndrome but does not provide specific results regarding iodine's effects. The focus is on reviewing current methods for prevention and treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with Frey syndrome following parotidectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the dosimetric parameters of the new IrSeed-125 brachytherapy source using Monte Carlo simulation and compare them to other commercially available iodine sources.
results_summary: The study found that the dosimetric characteristics of the IrSeed-125 source, including dose rate constant and anisotropy functions, were comparable to other iodine sources and aligned with previously measured data. The Monte Carlo simulations provided reliable parameters for dose distribution calculations per TG-43 (U1) protocol.
population_specificity: Not specified (study focused on source dosimetry, not human subjects).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study involved simulation, not human dosing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of radioactive iodine (I-131) in pediatric thyroid disorders, focusing on its efficacy, safety, and differences in outcomes compared to adults.
results_summary: The study found that I-131 is effective for treating pediatric differentiated thyroid cancers (DTC) and hyperthyroidism due to Graves' disease, with children showing rapid response and excellent prognosis. However, children have higher recurrence rates and longer-term risks from radiation exposure compared to adults.
population_specificity: Children with differentiated thyroid cancers (DTC) or hyperthyroidism due to Graves' disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of iodine-131 tositumomab (Bexxar) in radioimmunotherapy (RIT) for aggressive lymphoma, particularly in combination with high-dose chemotherapy and autologous stem-cell transplantation (ASCT).
results_summary: The study found that iodine-131 tositumomab (Bexxar) showed safety and efficacy in treating aggressive lymphoma, but a large randomized trial did not demonstrate a survival advantage over rituximab-BEAM. RIT can target radiation to disease sites while limiting exposure to healthy tissues, making it a potential candidate for ASCT conditioning.
population_specificity: Patients with chemosensitive-relapsed or chemosensitive-refractory aggressive lymphoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of multiple-micronutrient supplementation, including iodine, on maternal and infant health outcomes in breastfeeding mothers.
results_summary: The study found no quantitative evidence to assess the effectiveness of multiple-micronutrient supplementation, including iodine, due to limited data, small sample sizes, and lack of reported outcomes. One qualitative finding suggested potential benefits for maternal anemia, but no conclusive results were available.
population_specificity: Breastfeeding mothers with low socioeconomic status, including adolescent mothers in Brazil and women in the USA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if thyroglobulin (Tg) could serve as an effective biomarker for assessing iodine status in mildly iodine-deficient adults.
results_summary: The study found that iodine supplementation (150 μg/day) significantly increased urinary iodine concentration (UIC) and reduced Tg levels by up to 27% compared to placebo, without affecting TSH or FT4 levels, indicating Tg's utility as a biomarker for iodine status in adults.
population_specificity: Mildly iodine-deficient adults (n = 112) aged 18–40 years in Dunedin, New Zealand.
effective_dosage: 150 μg of iodine (as potassium iodate) daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evolution of treatment approaches for well-differentiated thyroid cancer, focusing on surgical strategies and the role of radioactive iodine.
results_summary: The study highlights a shift towards more conservative treatment for low-risk thyroid cancer patients, emphasizing improved risk-stratification and questioning potential overtreatment with radioactive iodine.
population_specificity: Patients with well-differentiated thyroid cancer, particularly low-risk cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the causes, symptoms, management, and outcomes of nasolacrimal duct obstructions caused by iodine-131 therapy and propose a screening protocol.
results_summary: The study found that nasolacrimal duct obstruction occurs in 2.2% to 18% of patients after iodine-131 therapy, mostly in those receiving over 150 mCi. Dacryocystorhinostomy was effective in managing the condition.
population_specificity: Patients receiving radioiodine therapy, particularly those administered more than 150 mCi.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the imaging characteristics and clinical feasibility of (124)I PET/CT for determining disease extent and assessing RAI kinetics in patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).
results_summary: (124)I PET/CT demonstrated high sensitivity (92.5%) and identified 22.5% more RAI-avid lesions compared to planar (131)I scans. It also revealed distinct kinetic profiles for thyroid remnants, salivary glands, and metastatic lesions.
population_specificity: 15 patients (6 women; age range 29-91 years) with confirmed differentiated thyroid cancer.
effective_dosage: 2 mCi (124)I in liquid form, followed by RAI treatment with (131)I (100-300 mCi).
study_duration: Sequential imaging at five time points (2-4 h, 24±6 h, 48±6 h, 72±6 h, and 96±6 h post-administration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the risk of contrast-induced nephropathy (CIN) for different iodine-based contrast media within and between osmolality classes in patients undergoing diagnostic or therapeutic imaging procedures.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in CIN risk among types of low-osmolar contrast media (LOCM), but a slight reduction in CIN risk with the iso-osmolar agent iodixanol compared to LOCM, though the difference was not clinically significant. The evidence strength was low for LOCM comparisons and moderate for iodixanol vs. LOCM.
population_specificity: Patients receiving diagnostic or therapeutic imaging procedures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of kinase inhibitors (sorafenib and lenvatinib) in treating radio-iodine refractory metastatic thyroid cancers.
results_summary: The study found that kinase inhibitors significantly improved response rates and progression-free survival compared to placebo, leading to their approval for treating these cancers. Patients also benefited from advancements in interventional radiology and multidisciplinary care.
population_specificity: Patients with radio-iodine refractory metastatic thyroid cancers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the influence of a single very low dose (0.03 mg) of recombinant human thyrotropin (rhTSH) on radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) and thyroid function in euthyroid and subclinical hyperthyroid patients with large multinodular goiter.
results_summary: The study found that a single very low dose of rhTSH significantly increased RAIU in both euthyroid and subclinical hyperthyroid patients, with no statistically significant differences between the groups. The administration of rhTSH was well-tolerated, and thyroid function remained within normal ranges post-treatment.
population_specificity: 40 patients (14 male, 26 female, age 57-80 years) with large non-toxic multinodular goiter over 80 grams and baseline RAIU < 40%.
study_duration: Follow-up measurements were taken at 1st, 2nd day, 4 weeks, and 8 weeks post-RIT.

study_goal: The researchers evaluated the effectiveness of povidone-iodine as a nasal and topical decolonization agent for preventing healthcare-associated infections.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine was reviewed as a potential nasal and topical decolonization agent, but large clinical trials are still needed to confirm its effectiveness. The abstract does not strongly recommend povidone-iodine for decolonization at this time.
population_specificity: Patients at risk of healthcare-associated infections, particularly surgical patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the outcomes of synthetic therapy, including (131)I radio-iodine, in treating calvaria metastasis from follicular thyroid carcinoma (FTC).
results_summary: The study found that combined therapy, including (131)I radio-iodine, total tumor resection, and adjunctive treatments, resulted in no tumor recurrence in two out of three cases, suggesting efficacy in managing FTC metastasis. However, one patient died due to extensive metastasis after abandoning further treatment.
population_specificity: Three patients with calvaria metastasis from follicular thyroid carcinoma (FTC).
study_duration: Follow-up ranged from 21 to 30 months post-operation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefits of dual-energy MDCT and multi-energy applications, including iodine maps, for improving renal lesion characterization compared to traditional MDCT imaging.
results_summary: The study found that dual-energy MDCT and multi-energy applications, particularly iodine maps, enhance renal lesion interpretation and throughput by overcoming limitations like pseudoenhancement in renal cysts and incomplete characterization at traditional MDCT. The technique shows promise but requires familiarity with interpretative traps and optimal protocols.
population_specificity: Patients with renal lesions undergoing imaging.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of different surgical hand antisepsis methods, including povidone iodine scrubs, in reducing surgical site infections (SSIs) and bacterial colony-forming units (CFUs) on hands.
results_summary: Povidone iodine scrubs were less effective than chlorhexidine gluconate scrubs in reducing CFUs, but no clear difference in SSI rates was found between iodine-based and other antiseptic methods. The clinical relevance of CFU reduction remains unclear.
population_specificity: Surgical teams and patients undergoing invasive procedures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of multikinase inhibitors, particularly lenvatinib, in treating radioactive iodine (RAI)-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).
results_summary: The study found that lenvatinib demonstrated highly promising clinical activity in RAI-refractory thyroid cancer, leading to regulatory approval and potentially making it the most effective treatment available for the disease. Sorafenib also showed significant improvement in progression-free survival.
population_specificity: Patients with recurrent RAI-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of thyroid hormone withdrawal followed by TSH-suppressive dosages of synthetic thyroid hormone (levothyroxine) on energy expenditure and brown adipose tissue activity.
results_summary: The study found that synthetic thyroid hormone significantly increased basal metabolic rate (BMR) and non-shivering thermogenesis (NST), as well as brown adipose tissue (BAT) activity in the subclinical hyperthyroid state compared to the hypothyroid state.
population_specificity: Ten patients with well-differentiated thyroid carcinoma eligible for surgical treatment and subsequent radioactive iodine ablation therapy.
effective_dosage: TSH-suppressive dosages of levothyroxine (specific dosage not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether early levothyroxine (LT4) administration post-radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy improves quality of life (QoL) in patients with Graves' disease.
results_summary: Early LT4 administration significantly improved QoL scores (SF-36 and ThyPRO) compared to standard follow-up, with no differences in Graves' ophthalmopathy outcomes, thyroid status, or TRAbs levels. No adverse cardiovascular events were reported.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' hyperthyroidism (n=94).

study_goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of 0.75% povidone iodine solution in decontaminating postmortem donor eyes during tissue processing.
results_summary: The study found that a 3-minute bath in 0.75% povidone iodine solution significantly reduced microbial contamination in donor eyes (1/184 eyes remained contaminated). However, iodine staining and corneal epithelial erosion were observed as side effects in eyes treated with additional mucosal disinfectant.
population_specificity: Postmortem eyes from 92 human donors.
effective_dosage: 0.75% povidone iodine solution for at least 3 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether thyroid function and autoimmunity vary with weight status in children and adolescents and to determine if hyperthyrotropinemia is associated with cardiovascular risk factors.
results_summary: Obese children had higher TSH levels than overweight or normal-weight subjects, but free thyroxine and urinary iodine levels did not differ significantly. The prevalence of thyroid autoimmunity was higher in overweight and obese subjects, but the clinical significance of these differences was minimal.
population_specificity: Healthy children and adolescents aged 2-16 years in Almería, Spain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether reapplication of a surgical site preparation solution (SPS) containing iodine povacrylex and isopropyl alcohol after draping reduces surgical site infections (SSIs) in total joint arthroplasty (TJA) patients.
